datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: SCGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SCSPID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C103330

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in SCTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in SCTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g."1TEST"). SCTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Example: SUBJINIT, EYECD.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Characteristic Short Name
datasetVariables.name: SCTESTCD

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCTEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in SCTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: Subject Initials, Eye Color.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Characteristic
datasetVariables.name: SCTEST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of related records.
datasetVariables.label: Category for Subject Characteristic
datasetVariables.name: SCCAT

datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Subject Characteristic
datasetVariables.name: SCSCAT

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

datasetVariables.description: Result of the subject characteristic as originally received or collected.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
datasetVariables.name: SCORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCORRESU

datasetVariables.description: Original Unit in which the data were collected. The unit for SCORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Original Units
datasetVariables.name: SCORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from SCORRES in a standard format or standard units. SCSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in SCSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in SCORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in SCSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: SCSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from SCSTRESC. SCSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: SCSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for SCSTRESC or SCSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: SCSTRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate that the measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in SCORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: SCSTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why the observation has no result. Example: subject refused. Used in conjunction with SCSTAT when value is NOT DONE.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Performed
datasetVariables.name: SCREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SC.SCDY

datasetVariables.description: 1. Study day of collection, measured as integer days. 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Examination
datasetVariables.name: SCDY

description: A findings domain that contains subject-related data not collected in other domains. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49610, 2018-06-29)
label: Subject Characteristics
name: SC
